Topic.Title: issue with "Remaking the default custom map" by Duodecimus

Posts.EditableText:
Initial Thread: https://textadventures.co.uk/forum/samples/topic/5719/guide-remaking-the-default-custom-map

I played around with the code for the map customization and was able to shape my room and the exit the way I want to. Here's the problem: 

New file, enabled the map, inserted the "before enter room"-variable, then the "after entering room"-script as instructed. I changed the size of the first room to 2x2, put the exit line on the lower left and tried to move to the 2nd room. Moving works BUT the instant I click "move/south" the map resets to, i guess, default and displays the first room as a regular 1x1 with a centered exit line connecting to the second room. Moving back and forth works fine though. EDIT: The first room kepps changing to it's desired 2x2 form everytime I re-enter it.  Any idea how to keep the first room/all rooms at their size constantly? 

My goal is to have some sort of architectual layout of an actual house. No exit lines, rooms adjacent to each other and so forth.
